TextView.android:text: As ancient and traditional cooking practices go, zarb is perhaps the most dramatic. It consists of lamb or chicken, and sometimes herbs and vegetables, which have been buried in an oven with hot coals beneath the desert sands. When itâ€™s time for the meat to resurface, the sand is brushed away, the lid comes off, and the glorious slow-roasted fragrances billow into the air. While a few things have changed in the preparation of this delicious dish, the meat still falls off the bone just as it would have hundreds of years ago.
